name: j_a_s_e
text:
Pat is a stone-cold dick to everyone .
Be interesting to see how he works out with Rod Huggins.

name: rolotonybrowntown
text: A comment left by rolotonybrowntown was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tttt, TTAGXAMM, sid, Audhumla, pquinn87, LocusCosecant)

name: i_love_kate
text: Shrewd observation or reference to the alt text... or both?

name: dougthehead
text: Haha, Pat's all confused.  "Why is everyone being nice to me?  That's not how you treat people!"

name: jesler729
text: I love how low to the ground he gets.

name: tinhand
text: There's no gesture as romantic as yelling into your womans teeth.

name: mirzabah
text:
Somewhere, Paul is wondering: Did Travis get my message?

No. No, he did not.

name: relaxing
text: Crung!

name: deancain29
text: poor Paul.

name: solobuttons
text: "Oh crung" is the best expression.

name: vweep
text: The best song, played on the prettiest guitar.

name: farqussus
text: Apparently people do not agree, or are ambivalent. I am of ambivalent agreement.

name: puguglypress
text: Especially when Pat says it

name: ngazin
text: Why are people so quick to forgive Pat?  Pat is the worst.

name: mcnubbins
text: You have no faith in the essential decency of the white man's culture.

name: dorothypoopbot
text: Hunter S. Thompson would be proud.

name: puguglypress
text: Oh, OUCH!

name: prettyrad
text: Pat has some hell of supportive friends. They know he's tryin' to get anger management to work out.

name: captainpeepers
text:
I sometimes forget that Pat is a california boy, because he always uses phrases like "what the devil" and such, so I imagine him with an old english accent.

And then he uses a word like "ain't" and it throws my whole perception of him out of whack.

name: dans
text: I get the idea that Pat intentionally says things like "what the devil" to sound sophisticated (think one of those douches that spell "color" with a u, even though they are american), and when he goes and says "ain't," that's him slipping.

name: quinlaenar
text: I have so many British friends and play so many British games that words like colour and armour are spelled that way. I am American. I'm not a douche, I just am exposed to that spelling more often, so I use it more often.

name: _cheesekayke
text:
I've always wondered what anger management issues Arthur could possibly have had.
It's just so hard to imagine.

name: jdhenry105
text: He just sucks a furrrrrrrrrrious dick.

name: semiquaver
text: I have never actually laughed so hard at an assetbar comment.  Mostly because I heard it in my brain being bellowed in the voice of Richard Griffiths.

name: semiquaver
text: Okay, tell a lie.  It's really more of a Wilford Brimley.

name: biznart
text: Vans don't buy themselves.

name: stuart
text: Is the alt text some sort of talk about The Critic?

name: ganymedeio
text: This is also what I am wondering.

name: thesyndicate88
text: I love the way only Pat's eyebrows move while he's listening to his messages.

name: endoftheworld
text: This strip makes me want to call random numbers and leave interesting messages on answering machines. It could be a new performance art.

name: salo
text:
I actually got payed to do this very thing for quite a while.
Then my boss found out and I needed to cold telemarket.
It was Hell.

name: nigelchaos
text: Could Cornelius be British? He's not back "from the hospital".. he's back "from hospital".

name: rowboat
text: He's a bear of the world.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Our Nigel gone shop, buy booze, get mad bobbinsed. Gotta chip, pay lecky.

name: nigelchaos
text: Wait, what?

name: wittyname
text: The last panel, with Pats change of expression and everything, pushed this comic up from a 3 to a 5.

name: aelindil
text: A Fun Thing to Do: Flip through the phone book and choose three or so numbers at random.  If a machine picks up, leave the text of panel 6 as your message.  Repeat until you sober up or are threatened with legal action.

name: direhaggis
text: You can tell by Pat's eyebrows that he's still hella pissed off at Roast Beef for having is Aibo, but is otherwise confused about his messages.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Pat blames Beef for Pat shooting Cornelius.

name: tttt2
text: Beef's message makes this a 5

name: firesign
text:
I had not one but two instances such as panel 6 happen on my answering machine in my college apartment. Our answering machine just said "Hey, leave a message" in my roommate's not so distinctive voice, so I guess people didn't think twice about whether the number was right.

1) "This is Chang. Wednesday will work; you bring the money and meet me where we talked about, in the parking lot in front of the warehouse."

(I had not talked to anyone about exchanging money in front of a warehouse, nor do I know a Chang)

2. "Marty, this is Ron. Listen, I have to go out to the store, so I need you to call April, and talk to her, and do your best to convince her to hang in there until I can get back."

(I am not Marty, and I do not know Ron or April. Unfortunately for Marty [and April?], we didn't have caller ID and were unable to tell Ron that Marty hadn't gotten this apparently very time-sensitive message)

name: em2
text: Hella Rockford Files...

name: ham_shoes
text: Pat's glasses just kind of hang on his face in the most delightful way

name: grigori
text: I love that Roast Beef remembers the number of days that have passed.

name: carlyle
text: Pat's confused on how Paul got his real number, but not his real name.

name: pumpinpedal
text: Man Pat's answering machine is HUGE.

name: soticoto
text: My latest marker-comment.
